snippet: A law professor asserts that the war on drugs and incarceration for drug offenses are ways to limit the gains of the civil rights movement.
abstract: Law professor Michelle Alexander has galvanized debate about the war on drugs with her best-selling book The New Jim Crow: Mass Incarceration in the Age of Colorblindness, in which she asserts that incarceration for drug offenses is a way to limit the gains of the civil rights movement.
lead_paragraph: A law professor asserts that the war on drugs and incarceration for drug offenses are ways to limit the gains of the civil rights movement.

headline.seo: Michelle Alexander’s ‘New Jim Crow’ Raises Drug Law Debates
headline.main: Drug Policy as Race Policy: Best Seller Galvanizes the Debate
